title: European stock indexes move higher on trade hopes, gains for oil majors
text:
European benchmarks moved higher on Thursday, inspired by fresh hopes over U.S.-China trade talks. Gains were led by oil majors, while shares of Pearson PLC and Imperial Brands PLC slumped on profit warnings.

The Stoxx Europe 600 index SXXP, +0.74% rose 0.7% to 390.30, bucking weakness seen at the open.

U.S. President Donald Trump said Wednesday that a deal to end the protracted U.S. trade war with China could happen “sooner than you think,” while speaking to reporters, noting that China wants “to make a deal very badly.” His comments helped U.S. stocks close higher Wednesday, partly by distracting investors from House Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s formal launch Tuesday of an impeachment inquiry into the U.S. President.

Also driving optimism over U.S-China trade talks was Wednesday’s news that the U.S. and Japan had signed an limited trade deal.

The German DAX DAX, +0.53% rose 0.6% to 12306.52, the French CAC 40 PX1, +0.72% climbed 0.8% to 5628.97 and the U.K. FTSE 100 UKX, +1.31% climbed 0.8% to 7353.46.

Heavily-weighed oil majors led the gains in Europe, with BP PLC BP, +1.45% BP, +0.13% up 1.8% and French group Total SA TOT, +0.73% FP, +0.30% rising 0.6%. Royal Dutch Shell PLC RDS.A, +0.93% RDS.B, +1.07% climbed 1.1%.

On the downside, ABN Amro ABN, -13.32% fell 8% after the bank said the Dutch public prosecutor is probing it over money laundering prevention and the financing of terrorism. Last year, rival ING ING, -0.29% was fined over similar charges. ABN Amro said it will fully cooperate with the probe.

Leading the decliners, Pearson PLC PSON, -13.92% plunged 17% after the U.K. educational publisher warned of weaker than expected third-quarter performance at its U.S. higher-education unit, and said it expects full-year adjusted operating profit to come in at the bottom of guidance.

And shares of Imperial Brands PLC IMB, -11.12% tumbled 10% after the tobacco company warned of weaker revenue due to challenges in its next-generation products (NGP) market in the U.S. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has been cracking down on e-cigarettes following a recent outbreak of severe lung disease that appears to be related to vaping.

description: European stocks are in the black, boosted by fresh hopes for a U.S. trade deal, with oil majors out in front..
